inlineContent.text: You may use this package as a stand-alone swift project. You may perform the standard package manager commands to build
To generate the binary for this package, it is preferred that you perform a release build.
You may then invoke the binary via:

abstract.text: A target for generating the GUUnits package.
CPP Time Units Generator.
A protocol that provides all the functions required to generate a function in
an underlying language.
Function that generates the C function definitions for converting between units and numeric types within
the same unit category.
Struct that generates the code for all the possible conversion functions.
A struct for converting between numeric types and unit types.
Struct for creating the C header file.
A protocol for representing unit types that exist within a unit category.
A unit category represents a type of data that can be expressed with different
units. Examples include Distance, Time, Angles, etc. Conforming types might
contain many units for a category, e.g. Distance can have metres, centimetres,
millimetres, etc.
is the main target of
. This target provides the unit and category
definitions for all the code generated in
This guide demonstrates the process for creating
. A composite unit is a unit category
that is created from other units.
A function body creator that converts between different units by scaling
the magnitude of one unit by a constant value. Examples of this type of
behaviour is seen in SI units where kilo is 1000 times smaller than the
Mega prefix.
A
that uses the parameters specified in
Protocol for conforming types to convert to and from numeric unit types. The
conversion functions generate appropriate code to cast between unit types
and numeric types.
A struct for storing information about a unit conversion within the same
category.
A function creator that generates code for temperature conversions. This function
creator can handle conversions between common temperature units such as
Kelvin, degrees Celsius, and degrees Fahrenheit.
Swift file creator for generating XCTest based files.
A unit that represents Acceleration in SI units.
Struct used to generate test parameters for units that are convertable using
constant factors. e.g. 10 millimetres in a centimetre.
Protocol that helps units conformance to
that use units
that are displaced using base10 increments. For example, this protocol can be used
with SI units utilising the SI prefixes nano (10^-9), micro (10^-6), milli (10^-3),
centi (10^-2), kilo (10^3), mega (10^6), etc. The
static constant expresses
each unit to the exponent used in the base 10 calculation, E.g. millimetres would have
an exponent of -3 since it uses the milli prefix.
Helper struct that generates C function calls that convert between numeric
types and unit types.
Generator used for
types.
Temperature Units Generator
A struct that creates c-code for converting a unit between it’s signed and unsigned variants.
A unit may need to be represented as a different type in the c-implementation. The functions in
this struct perform a cast into the desired unit without performing any unit conversions.
Distance Units Generator
This guide provides instructions for creating relations between different unit categories. A user may use a relation to convert a unit
into another unit from a different category.
Protocol that specifies generation function for creating function definitions
for conversion functions between unit and numeric types.
Class for storing expected test result from an input.
Category for temperature units.
A struct which generates function bodies that delegate to the correct conversion function.
Conforming types will generate test parameters for a specific unit.
Provides non-SI acceleration units.
Defines a velocity unit with a base unit of metres per second.
A Unit for representing distances.
Enum for defining common operations in a composite unit.
A unit that represents angles.
Enum containing the standard guunits signs.

in it’s definition.
A type containing Swift-supported types for guunits.
Creates the contents for a test file. This struct generates all of the test code required

A unit for describing electrical current. The SI unit is the Ampere (C/s).

Enumeration for representating different types of primitive values. These types represent
different real and rational numbers with differing precision.

that works with
types.
A struct for generating CPP function definitions for conversion functions between unit types
and numeric types. The difference between the generated code in this struct and the C-equivalent
definitions is the fact that C function must be unique. The functions generated by this struct
may contain duplicate names but different type signatures.
Provides a guide and example for creating new units.
Units for representing image data.
The numeric types supported by guunits.
This protocol provides conversion functions for units within the same category.
The conversion functions produce an
that will define the function required
to perform the conversion.

A function creator that delegates all methods to stored body creators, definition creators,

A unit for describing rotational velocity. This unit uses the SI unit
radians per second (rad/s) as the base unit.
